name: ☁️ Cinnamon Swirl Cloud Bread ☁️
description: "Bread without the bloat." Low-carb comfort! Senior-friendly light fluffy bread that's easy to chew. Perfect for blood sugar control, evening cravings satisfied!
steps: Whip egg whites until fluffy
Fold in cottage cheese gently
Add cinnamon swirl
Bake at 300°F for 25 minutes
Enjoy warm!
notes: Low-carb comfort bread. Senior-friendly, light and fluffy texture. Good for blood sugar control.

name: Homemade Chicken Nuggets 🍗
description: High protein homemade chicken nuggets - 372 calories, 51g protein
steps: Add all ingredients to food processor
Blend until smooth mixture forms
Shape into nugget shapes
Place on baking tray
Bake at 200°C (390°F) for 18-20 minutes
Serve hot and enjoy!

name: 1 Calorie Meringue Cookies
description: Yes you saw that right - 1 calorie meringue cookies! So easy to make with just a few ingredients and perfect for snacking!
ingredients: ¼ tsp cream of tartar (optional, helps stabilise)
½ tsp vanilla extract (or almond extract)
Sugar substitute for baking equal to 200g sugar sweetness (e.g., erythritol, xylitol, allulose, or blend like Sukrin Gold)
steps: [Steps not fully visible in screenshot - see video for complete instructions]
notes: Complete ingredients from comments. Steps: Whip egg whites with cream of tartar until stiff peaks, gradually add sweetener and vanilla, pipe onto baking sheet, bake low and slow until crisp.

name: ❄️ Protein Cinnamon Buns ❄️
steps: Mix yogurt, flour and baking powder in a bowl and knead with your hands
Form into a ball then roll out into a thin rectangle
Spray light layer of cooking spray, followed by cinnamon/zero cal sweetener
Roll it up and slice into 4 equal size pieces
Place in baking dish and bake at 350°F for 20-30 min until puffy and golden
While baking, make icing by combining yogurt, protein powder, and cream cheese in a bowl
Whisk icing until smooth
Pour icing over warm cinnamon buns
Enjoy!

name: 53g Protein Crustless Pizza Pie
ingredients: 4 oz (115g) turkey pepperoni or chicken breast pieces
Optional toppings: mushrooms, bell peppers, olives, onions, jalapeños, fresh basil
Optional: pinch of red pepper flakes
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (205°C)
Prep a 9-inch pie dish with non-stick spray or oil
Whisk eggs in a bowl, then add cottage cheese, mozzarella, Parmesan, Italian seasoning, garlic powder, and pepper. Stir until combined.
Pour mixture into prepared dish and bake for 18-22 minutes until set and edges are golden
Remove from oven and spread pizza sauce on top
Add pepperoni/chicken and any extra toppings, plus extra mozzarella if desired
Bake again for 8-12 minutes until cheese melts and top looks pizza-like
Optional: Broil for 1-2 minutes for browning (watch carefully)
Let cool for 10 minutes to firm up, then slice and serve

name: 🥭 Mango Craving Stopper
description: A refreshing mango smoothie perfect for stopping cravings. Simple 3-ingredient recipe.
steps: Add frozen mango to blender
Add Greek yoghurt
Add sweetener if desired
Blend until smooth
Enjoy immediately!
notes: Quick and easy craving buster. Great post-workout or as a healthy snack.

name: 🍌 Chia Banana Protein Snack
description: A healthy chia banana protein snack packed with nutrients and energy. Perfect pre or post-workout.
steps: In a bowl or jar, combine chia seeds and milk
Stir well to prevent clumping
Mash the ripe banana and add to the mixture
Add turmeric powder, cinnamon powder, and honey
Mix everything together thoroughly
Let sit for 10-15 minutes (or overnight in fridge) for chia to absorb liquid
Enjoy as a healthy snack!
notes: Can be prepared ahead and stored in fridge. Great for meal prep. Add protein powder for extra protein boost.

name: 🍰 Wannabe Tiramisu
description: A healthy, high-protein tiramisu alternative that's oh so good! Only 280 calories and 20g protein.
steps: Brew a cup of coffee and let it cool
Mix Greek yoghurt with protein pudding
Add honey or syrup to sweeten
Dip rice cakes briefly in cooled coffee
Layer rice cakes and yoghurt mixture
Dust top with cocoa powder
Refrigerate for 30 minutes before serving
notes: High protein dessert perfect for post-workout or healthy treat. Use full-fat Greek yoghurt for extra creaminess.

name: 🍪 Brookie Cookie Dough
description: This brookie version is a HUGE VIBE! We love a no bake, simple and delicious snack! Raw edible cookie dough meets brownie.
steps: Mix yoghurt and maple syrup in a bowl
Add vanilla protein powder and mix well
Add almond flour and cacao powder
Fold in dark chocolate chips
Enjoy as raw cookie dough or roll into balls
Store in refrigerator
notes: No-bake edible cookie dough. Can be eaten raw or shaped into balls. Store refrigerated.
